content.title: Intro
content.content: -mar is a Quenya suffix that has three meanings.

content.title: -mar1
content.content: -mar, pl. -mardi, means dwelling.[1] Although Angmar is a Sindarin name, the Quenya suffix -mar and the Sindarin suffix -bar come from the same root, MBAR.

content.title: -mar2
content.content: Used for the 'residence' of a family, the whole area occupied or owned by a family or 'kindred'. Also used with a defining genitive or in genitival compound. When added to a personal name (e.g. Ingwemar) it signified the 'residence' of a family of which the 'head' was the named person. After the name of a people of 'kindred' (e.g. Eldamar) it referred to the whole area occupied or owned by them, in which their dwellings or 'houses' were distributed and in which they were settled and were 'at home' as long as they remained as united people.[2]

content.title: -mar3
content.content: (from Root MBAR settle) Used for a region settled/ inhabited by a people, community or group.[3] An example would be Eldamar (elda + mar), which means "Elvenhome".[4]
